snippet: An official said criminal charges would almost certainly be filed in the death of Chun Hsien Deng, who suffered severe trauma to the head during a retreat.
abstract: Official says criminal charges will almost certainly be filed in the hazing death of Baruch College student Chun Hsien Deng, who suffered severe trauma to the head during a fraternity retreat in Pennsylvania; leadership of Pi Delta Psi fraternity says retreat was unsanctioned event that was strictly prohibited.

byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER and ARIEL KAMINER
byline.contributor: Nate Schweber reported from Tunkhannock Township, and Ariel Kaminer from New York.

lead_paragraph: An official said criminal charges would almost certainly be filed in the death of Chun Hsien Deng, who suffered severe trauma to the head during a retreat.

headline.main: Details, but Few Answers, Emerge in Hazing Death of Baruch Student
headline.print_headline: Details, but Few Answers, Emerge in Hazing Death of Baruch Student
